intro: Ruschia cradockensis subsp. cradockensis, commonly known as the Cradock Ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptability to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are often arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
